title: 111_s3427
content: The Act is titled the "Pre-Paid Mobile Device Identification Act" and includes definitions for various terms. The "Pre-Paid Mobile Device Identification Act" defines terms such as authorized reseller, pre-paid mobile device, SIM card, and wireless carrier. The "Pre-Paid Mobile Device Identification Act" requires purchasers to provide their full name, complete home address, and date of birth before buying a pre-paid mobile device or SIM card. The "Pre-Paid Mobile Device Identification Act" mandates that authorized resellers verify purchaser information by requiring a photographic ID issued by the government or specific documents like Form W-2 or Form 1099. The Act requires authorized resellers to verify purchaser information by submitting specific documents like Form 1099 from the Social Security Administration or other federal agencies, or any document approved by the Attorney General. The Act requires purchasers to provide valid credit or debit card information, Social Security number, driver's license number, and any other personal identifying information deemed necessary by the Attorney General. SEC. 5. RECORD MAKING REQUIREMENT. Upon completion of a sale of a pre-paid mobile device or SIM card, an authorized reseller must record purchaser information, sale date, manufacturer, wireless carrier, assigned telephone number, and international mobile equipment identifier number if applicable. The curr_chunk lists different identifiers including International mobile equipment identifier number, Electronic serial number, Mobile equipment identifier, International mobile subscriber identifier, and Machine address code. SEC. 6 requires authorized resellers to transmit sales records of prepaid mobile devices or SIM cards to the wireless carrier within 30 days via secure electronic transmission. SEC. 7 outlines recordkeeping requirements. SEC. 7 requires wireless carriers to provide a transmission confirmation receipt to authorized resellers after receiving the sale record. The carriers must retain the sale record for 18 months or until they stop providing service to the related mobile device or SIM card, following privacy protections outlined in section 222 of the Communications Act of 1934. (a) A purchaser providing false or misleading information under sections 3 and 4 will face criminal penalties. (b) Failure to comply by authorized resellers or carriers will result in a $50 civil fine per offense, with each sale without proper purchaser identification constituting a separate offense. For purposes of this section, a wireless carrier is not responsible for an offense of an authorized reseller, and an authorized reseller is not responsible for an offense of a wireless carrier. SEC. 9. RELATED OFFENSES. It is unlawful for nonauthorized resellers to sell pre-paid mobile devices or SIM cards. Violators may face a fine of up to $500, imprisonment for at least 1 year, or both. The Attorney General will establish regulations for notifying purchasers of the offense and penalty. If a pre-paid mobile device or SIM card obtained in violation is used to commit a Federal crime, the minimum imprisonment term will be increased by 1 year. SEC. 10. PREEMPTION DISCLAIMER. States have the power to enact additional requirements regarding the distribution and sale of mobile devices or SIM cards, without being preempted by this Act.
